originalText: Are there directions?
text: Are any driving directions needed for this patient?
codingInstructions: Unless specifically indicated in the notes, select "No" as the answer to this question.

originalText: Directions
text: Indicate driving directions for this patient.

originalText: Evacuation Location
text: Disaster Evacuation Location:
alternateQuestionText: In the event of an emergency (e.g. natural disaster, public health emergency, etc.) that could impede home health services from reaching this patient, to what location would the patient be evacuated?
codingInstructions: If a disaster evacuation location is not indicated in the documents, response with "Shelter in place"

originalText: Acuity Status
text: Disaster Acuity Status:
alternateQuestionText: In the event of an emergency (e.g. natural disaster, public health emergency, etc.) that could impede home health services from reaching this patient, indicate the urgency with which a patient would need to be moved from their current location.

originalText: Disaster Status
text: Disaster Mobility Status:
alternateQuestionText: Indicate the patient's current ability to ambulate.

originalText: Face-to-Face Comments
text: Face-to-Face Comments
codingInstructions: If it has already happened, say when. If it is scheduled to happen, describe when. If it is not scheduled yet, describe any conversations with patient about scheduling.
itemNotes: If a F2F is not already marked as received, the nurse needs to acknowledge that. Need to document something like "Spoke to patient and instructed they need a F2F in next few weeks." OR "Patient has a F2F scheduled on X date."

originalText: (A1110A) WHAT IS YOUR PREFERRED LANGUAGE? TYPE: TEXT - MULTISELECT: N
text: Indicate the patient's primary spoken language.
codingInstructions: If nothing is specifically mentioned, select "English"

originalText: Religion
text: Indicate the patient's religion.
codingInstructions: If nothing is specifically mentioned, select "Unknown"

originalText: Marital Status
text: Marital Status:
alternateQuestionText: Indicate the patient's marital status.

originalText: Patient Goal
text: What was the patient's stated goal for home health care?
codingInstructions: This can be a sentence or sentence fragment - transcribe exactly what the nurse reported that the patient said.

originalText: Is there a Goal Comment?
text: Any comments on the patient's stated goal for home health?
codingInstructions: Unless specifically indicated in the notes, select "No" as the answer to this question.

originalText: Goal Comment
text: Indicate comments on patient's stated goal for home health.

originalText: INSTRUCT PATIENT / CAREGIVER ON  SIGNS / SYMPTOMS OF DISEASE THAT REQUIRE IMMEDIATE ATTENTION.
text: Was the intervention "Instruct patient / caregiver on signs / symptoms of disease that require immediate attention" provided during this visit?

originalText: Enter Details for INSTRUCT PATIENT / CAREGIVER ON  SIGNS / SYMPTOMS OF DISEASE THAT REQUIRE IMMEDIATE ATTENTION.
text: Provide details about how the intervention "Instruct patient/caregiver on signs/symptoms of disease that require immediate attention" was provided.
codingInstructions: The response should closely resemble the template. Select only the sentences that apply to this patient. If applicable, replace the asterisk with details specific to the patient's situation.
template:
Instructed patient/caregiver on signs/symptoms of disease that require immediate attention. 

Instructed patient in specific symptoms that necessitate calling the nurse, physician, or 911, including *. 

Instructed in signs / symptoms to report to physician or other health care provider and what to do in emergency situations.

originalText: PATIENT / CAREGIVER VERBALIZES SIGNS AND SYMPTOMS THAT REQUIRE IMMEDIATE ATTENTION.
text: Was the goal "Patient/caregiver verbalizes signs and symptoms that require immediate attention" met during this visit?

originalText: Which of the following best describes why the goal "Patient/caregiver verbalizes signs and symptoms that require immediate attention" was not met during this visit?
text: Which of the following best describes why the goal "Patient/caregiver verbalizes signs and symptoms that require immediate attention" was not met during this visit?

originalText: INSTRUCT PATIENT / CAREGIVER ON USAGE AND SIDE EFFECTS OF MEDICATION TO ENSURE PATIENT IS SAFE UNTIL NEXT VISIT.
text: Was the intervention "Instruct patient / caregiver on usage and side effects of medication to ensure patient is safe until next visit" provided during this visit?

originalText: Enter Details for INSTRUCT PATIENT / CAREGIVER ON USAGE AND SIDE EFFECTS OF MEDICATION TO ENSURE PATIENT IS SAFE UNTIL NEXT VISIT.
text: Provide details about how the intervention "Instruct patient/caregiver on usage and side effects of medication to ensure patient is safe until next visit" was provided.
codingInstructions: The response should closely resemble the template. Select only the sentences that apply to this patient. If applicable, replace the asterisk with details specific to the patient's situation.
template:
Instructed patient/caregiver on usage and side effects of medication to ensure patient is safe until next visit. 

Instructed patient/caregiver regarding complex medication management, including schedule, functions, routes, rationale for compliance, possible side effects, and when and what to report to the nurse or physician. 

Instructed patient/caregiver about the need to have prescriptions filled before the last dose(s) of medications. 

Assessed medication regimen for safety and drug/drug, drug/food interactions. 

Instructed regarding special precautions high-risk medications including *(name of hypoglycemics, anticoagulants, etc.), and how and when to report problems that may occur.

originalText: Enter Details for INSTRUCTED REGARDING ANY IDENTIFIED SAFETY HAZARDS
text: Provide details about how the intervention "Instructed regarding any identified safety hazards" was provided.
codingInstructions: The response should closely resemble the template. Select only the sentences that apply to this patient. If applicable, replace the asterisk with details specific to the patient's situation.
template:
Fall precautions. 

Provided intervention for identified evidence of patient abuse*/neglect*/exploitation* as follows: *. 

Instructed patient/caregiver* today regarding: *

Fire safety, *

Identified * as safety hazard(s). Educated patient/caregiver* on the impact on patient safety. 

Instructed patient/caregiver* that * must be corrected in order to provide a safe environment for patient. 

Home safety measures including * keeping clear pathways, eliminating clutter, cords/tubing, keeping telephone/items within reach, removing throw rugs, using (dme)* as indicated, pets, weapons * 

Oxygen safety issues - no smoking, need for ""No smoking signs"", no open flames, tubing kept out of pathways*,

originalText: EXPLORE CURRENT INTERVENTIONS FOR PATIENT WITH SIGNS / SYMPTOMS OF DEPRESSION, AND MAKE APPROPRIATE REFERRALS OR INQUIRIES.
text: Was the intervention "Explore current interventions for patient with signs / symptoms of depression, and make appropriate referrals or inquiries" provided during this visit?

originalText: Enter Details for EXPLORE CURRENT INTERVENTIONS FOR PATIENT WITH SIGNS / SYMPTOMS OF DEPRESSION, AND MAKE APPROPRIATE REFERRALS OR INQUIRIES.
text: Provide details about how the intervention "Explore current interventions for patient with signs/symptoms of depression, and make appropriate referrals or inquiries" was provided.
codingInstructions: The response should closely resemble the template, only including the sentences that are relevant to the patient.
template:
Physician was contacted about the patient's signs / symptoms of depression.

Discussion with patient/caregiver about signs / symptoms of depression. 

Provided resources which may be helpful: National Institute of Mental Health, National Alliance for the Mentally Ill, National Mental Illness Screening Project, and National Foundation for Depressive Illness, Inc. 

Instructed patient that exercise has been shown to be as helpful in reducing depression symptoms. 

Instructed that many nutrients have been found to have an impact on your mood. A diet that lacks key nutrients -- including vitamins, amino acids, minerals, and fatty acids -- may contribute to depression. The problem of insufficent nutrition is compounded by toxins, pollution, free-radicals, and modern agricultural practices.

text: Indicate the wound location.

text: Indicate the wound location.

Middle Edge of Foot, Right, Medial
Posterior Edge of Foot, Right, Medial

originalText: Torso
text: Indicate the wound location.

originalText: Select a Wound Type:
text: Indicate the wound type.

responses.text: Unstageable Pressure Ulcer- Suspected deep tissue injury
Unstageable Pressure Ulcer- Known or Likely But not stageable due to non-removable dressing or device
Unstageable Pressure Ulcer- Known or likely but not stageable due to coverage of wound bed by slough and/or eschar

originalText: Specify Other Wound Type
text: Specify other wound type.

originalText: Select Wound Location Descriptors
text: Indicate wound location descriptors.
codingInstructions: Describe where the wound is positioned relative to the wound's general anatomical location.

originalText: Select Wound Onset Date
text: Indicate wound onset date.

originalText: MEASUREMENTS TAKEN
text: Were wound measurements taken?
codingInstructions: Unless otherwise indicated in the documents, select 'yes' as the answer to this question when wounds are present.

originalText: LENGTH (CM)
text: Indicate wound length, in centimeters.
codingInstructions: Indicate the length of the wound.

originalText: WIDTH (CM)
text: Indicate wound width, in centimeters.
codingInstructions: Indicate the width of the wound.

originalText: DEPTH (CM)
text: Indicate wound depth, in centimeters.
codingInstructions: Indicate the depth of the wound.

originalText: REASON MEASUREMENTS NOT TAKEN
text: Indicate the reason wound measurements were not taken this visit.

originalText: OTHER COMMENTS REGARDING REASON MEASUREMENTS NOT TAKEN
text: Other comments regarding reason wound measurements not taken.

originalText: IS THIS A CLOSED SURGICAL WOUND OR SUSPECTED DEEP TISSUE INJURY?
text: Is this a closed surgical wound or suspected deep tissue injury?
codingInstructions:
CLOSED SURGICAL WOUND

SURGICAL WOUND CLOSED BY PRIMARY INTENTION BY SUTURES, STAPLES OR ADHESIVE; EDGES APPROXIMATED AND CLOSED.

SUSPECTED DEEP TISSUE INJURY -

PURPLE OR MAROON LOCALIZED AREA OF DISCOLORED INTACT SKIN OR BLOOD-FILLED BLISTER DUE TO DAMAGE OF UNDERLYING SOFT TISSUES FROM PRESSURE AND/OR SHEAR. THE AREA MAY BE PRECEDED BY TISSUE THAT IS PAINFUL, FIRM, MUSHY, BOGGY, WARMER OR COOLER AS COMPARED TO ADJACENT TISSUE.

originalText: INDICATE TYPE
text: Indicate whether the wound is a closed surgical wound or suspected deep tissue injury.

originalText: INDICATE WOUND CLOSURE
text: Indicate wound closure.

originalText: INDICATE OTHER TYPE OF WOUND CLOSURE
text: Describe other type of wound closure.

originalText: DEPTH DESCRIPTION
text: Indicate description of wound depth.

responses.text: Full thickness skin loss involving damage or necrosis of subcutaneous tissue; may extend down to but not through underlying fascia; &/or mixed partial & full thickness &/or tissue layers obscured by granulation tissue
Full thickness skin loss with extensive destruction, tissue necrosis or damage to muscle, bone or supporting structures

codingInstructions:
PICK THE DEPTH, THICKNESS, MOST APPROPRIATE TO THE WOUND USING THESE ADDITIONAL DESCRIPTIONS:
	--1 = TISSUES DAMAGED BUT NO BREAK IN SKIN SURFACE.
	--2 = SUPERFICIAL, ABRASION, BLISTER OR SHALLOW CRATER. EVEN WITH, &/OR ELEVATED ABOVE SKIN SURFACE (E.G., HYPERPLASIA). 

	--3 = DEEP CRATER WITH OR WITHOUT UNDERMINING OF ADJACENT TISSUE.

	--4 = VISUALIZATION OF TISSUE LAYERS NOT POSSIBLE DUE TO NECROSIS.
	--5 = SUPPORTING STRUCTURES INCLUDE TENDON, JOINT CAPSULE.

originalText: GRANULATION TISSUE
text: Indicate granulation tissue status.

responses.text: Skin intact or partial thickness wound
Bright, Beefy Red; 75% to 100% of Wound Filled &/or Tissue Overgrowth
Bright, beefy red; < 75% & > 25% of wound filled
Pink, &/or Dull, Dusky Red &/or Fills < = 25% of Wound

codingInstructions: GRANULATION TISSUE IS THE GROWTH OF SMALL BLOOD VESSELS AND CONNECTIVE TISSUE TO FILL IN FULL THICKNESS WOUNDS. TISSUE IS HEALTHY WHEN BRIGHT, BEEFY RED, SHINY AND GRANULAR WITH A VELVETY APPEARANCE. POOR VASCULAR SUPPLY APPEARS AS PALE PINK OR BLANCHED TO DULL, DUSKY RED COLOR.

originalText: EDGES
text: Indicate wound edge status.

responses.text: Distinct, outline clearly visible, attached, even with wound base
Well-defined, not attached to wound base
Well-defined, not attached to base, rolled under, thickened

codingInstructions: INDISTINCT, DIFFUSE = UNABLE TO CLEARLY DISTINGUISH WOUND OUTLINE.  ATTACHED = EVEN OR FLUSH WITH WOUND BASE, NO SIDES OR WALLS PRESENT; FLAT. NOT ATTACHED = SIDES OR WALLS ARE PRESENT; FLOOR OR BASE OF WOUND IS DEEPER THAN EDGE. ROLLED UNDER, THICKENED = SOFT TO FIRM AND FLEXIBLE TO TOUCH. HYPERKERATOSIS = CALLOUS-LIKE TISSUE FORMATION AROUND WOUND & AT EDGES.

originalText: SHAPE
text: Indicate wound shape.

originalText: EXUDATE TYPE
text: Indicate wound exudate type.

responses.text: Purulent - Thin or thick, opaque, tan/yellow, with or without odor

codingInstructions:
PICK THE EXUDATE TYPE THAT IS PREDOMINANT IN THE WOUND ACCORDING TO COLOR AND CONSISTENCY, USING THIS GUIDE:  BLOODY = THIN, BRIGHT RED
	--					SEROSANGUINEOUS = THIN, WATERY PALE RED TO PINK
	--					SEROUS = THIN, WATERY, CLEAR
	--					PURULENT = THIN OR THICK, OPAQUE TAN TO YELLOW
	--					FOUL PURULENT = THICK, OPAQUE YELLOW TO GREEN WITH OFFENSIVE ODOR

originalText: EXUDATE AMOUNT
text: Indicate wound exudate amount.
codingInstructions: NONE = DRY WOUND; SCANT = MOIST WOUND BUT NO OBSERVABLE EXUDATE; SMALL =  NON-ABSORBTIVE DRESSING MAY BE USED.  WEAR TIME UP TO 7 DAYS; MODERATE =  ABSORBTIVE DRESSING MAY BE REQUIRED.  WEAR TIME 2 - 3 DAYS; LARGE = WOUND TISSUES BATHED IN FLUID; DRAINAGE FREELY EXPRESSED; MAY OR MAY NOT BE EVENLY DISTRIBUTED IN WOUND; DRAINAGE INVOLVES > 75% OF DRESSING.

originalText: ODOR
text: Indicate odor associated with wound.
codingInstructions: Indicate whether there is an odor associated with the wound.

originalText: EPITHELIALIZATION
text: Indicate wound epithelialization status.

responses.text: 75% To < 100% wound covered &/or epithelial tissue extends > 0.5cm into wound bed
50% To < 75% wound covered &/or epithelial tissue extends to < 0.5cm into wound bed

codingInstructions: EPITHELIALIZATION IS THE PROCESS OF EPIDERMAL RESURFACING AND APPEARS AS PINK OR RED SKIN. IN PARTIAL THICKNESS WOUNDS IT CAN OCCUR THROUGHOUT THE WOUND BED AS WELL AS FROM THE WOUND EDGES. IN FULL THICKNESS WOUNDS IT OCCURS FROM THE EDGES ONLY.

originalText: NECROTIC TISSUE TYPE
text: Indicate wound necrotic tissue type.

responses.text: White/gray nonviable tissue &/or nonadherent yellow slough

codingInstructions:
PICK THE TYPE OF NECROTIC TISSUE THAT IS PREDOMINANT IN THE WOUND ACCORDING TO COLOR, CONSISTENCY AND ADHERENCE USING THIS GUIDE: WHITE/GRAY NON-VIABLE TISSUE = MAY APPEAR PRIOR TO WOUND OPENING; SKIN SURFACE IS WHITE OR GRAY. NON-ADHERENT, YELLOW SLOUGH = THIN, MUCINOUS SUBSTANCE; SCATTERED THROUGHOUT WOUND BED; EASILY SEPARATED FROM WOUND TISSUE.
	--					LOOSELY ADHERENT, YELLOW SLOUGH = THICK, STRINGY, CLUMPS OF DEBRIS; ATTACHED TO WOUND TISSUE.
	--					ADHERENT, SOFT, BLACK ESCHAR = SOGGY TISSUE; STRONGLY ATTACHED TO TISSUE IN CENTER OR BASE OF WOUND.
	--					FIRMLY ADHERENT, HARD/BLACK ESCHAR = FIRM, CRUSTY TISSUE; STRONGLY ATTACHED TO WOUND BASE AND EDGES (LIKE A HARD SCAB).

originalText: NECROTIC TISSUE AMOUNT
text: Indicate wound necrotic tissue amount.

originalText: TOTAL NECROTIC TISSUE SLOUGH
text: Indicate total necrotic tissue slough for wound.
codingInstructions: NON-ADHERENT, YELLOW SLOUGH = THIN, MUCINOUS SUBSTANCE; SCATTERED THROUGHOUT WOUND BED; EASILY SEPARATED FROM WOUND TISSUE. LOOSELY ADHERENT, YELLOW SLOUGH = THICK, STRINGY, CLUMPS OF DEBRIS; ATTACHED TO WOUND TISSUE.

originalText: TOTAL NECROTIC TISSUE ESCHAR
text: Indicate total necrotic tissue eschar for wound.
codingInstructions: ADHERENT, SOFT, BLACK ESCHAR = SOGGY TISSUE; STRONGLY ATTACHED TO TISSUE IN CENTER OR BASE OF WOUND. FIRMLY ADHERENT, HARD/BLACK ESCHAR = FIRM, CRUSTY TISSUE; STRONGLY ATTACHED TO WOUND BASE AND EDGES (LIKE A HARD SCAB).

originalText: EDGE / SURROUNDING TISSUE - MACERATION
text: Indicate amount of maceration to the edge/surrounding tissue of the wound.
codingInstructions: WHITE, WAXY, SOFT AND WET LOOKING TISSUE

originalText: UNDERMINING
text: Is wound undermining present?

responses.text: > 4 cm or Tunneling in any area

codingInstructions: UNDERMINING IS TISSUE DESTRUCTION AROUND THE WOUND PERIMETER UNDERLYING INTACT SKIN

originalText: UNDERMINING SIZE(CM)/LOCATION - 12 - 3 O'CLOCK
text: Indicate size of wound undermining in the 12-3 o'clock position.
codingInstructions: 12 O'CLOCK REPRESENTS DIRECTION OF HEAD

originalText: UNDERMINING SIZE(CM)/LOCATION - 3 - 6 O'CLOCK
text: Indicate size of wound undermining in the 3-6 o'clock position.
codingInstructions: 12 O'CLOCK REPRESENTS DIRECTION OF HEAD

originalText: UNDERMINING SIZE(CM)/LOCATION - 6 - 9 O'CLOCK
text: Indicate size of wound undermining in the 6-9 o'clock position.
codingInstructions: 12 O'CLOCK REPRESENTS DIRECTION OF HEAD

originalText: UNDERMINING SIZE(CM)/LOCATION - 9 - 12 O'CLOCK
text: Indicate size of wound undermining in the 9-12 o'clock position.
codingInstructions: 12 O'CLOCK REPRESENTS DIRECTION OF HEAD

originalText: TUNNELING
text: Is wound tunneling present?
codingInstructions: TUNNELING A CHANNEL THAT EXTENDS FROM ANY PART OF THE WOUND AND MAY PASS AWAY FROM THE WOUND THROUGH SUBCUTANEOUS TISSUE AND MUSCLE.

originalText: TUNNELING SIZE(CM)/LOCATION - 12 - 3 O'CLOCK
text: Indicate size of wound tunneling in the 12-3 o'clock position.
codingInstructions: 12 O'CLOCK REPRESENTS DIRECTION OF HEAD

originalText: TUNNELING SIZE(CM)/LOCATION - 3 - 6 O'CLOCK
text: Indicate size of wound tunneling in the 3-6 o'clock position.
codingInstructions: 12 O'CLOCK REPRESENTS DIRECTION OF HEAD

originalText: TUNNELING SIZE(CM)/LOCATION - 6 - 9 O'CLOCK
text: Indicate size of wound tunneling in the 6-9 o'clock position.
codingInstructions: 12 O'CLOCK REPRESENTS DIRECTION OF HEAD

originalText: TUNNELING SIZE(CM)/LOCATION - 9 - 12 O'CLOCK
text: Indicate size of wound tunneling in the 9-12 o'clock position.
codingInstructions: 12 O'CLOCK REPRESENTS DIRECTION OF HEAD

originalText: SKIN COLOR SURROUNDING WOUND
text: Indicate color of skin surrounding the wound.

responses.text: Pink or normal for ethnic group
White or gray pallor or hypopigmented

codingInstructions: ASSESS TISSUES WITHIN 4CM OF WOUND EDGE. DARK-SKINNED PERSONS SHOW THE COLORS "BRIGHT RED" AND "DARK RED" AS A DEEPENING OF NORMAL ETHNIC SKIN COLOR OR A PURPLE HUE. AS HEALING OCCURS IN DARK-SKINNED PERSONS, THE NEW SKIN IS PINK AND MAY NEVER DARKEN.

originalText: PERIPHERAL TISSUE EDEMA
text: Is peripheral tissue edema present surrounding the wound?

responses.text: Nonpitting edema extends < 4 cm around wound
Nonpitting edema extends >= 4 cm around wound
Pitting edema extends < 4 cm around wound
Crepitus and/or pitting edema extends >= 4 cm around wound

codingInstructions: ASSESS TISSUES WITHIN 4CM OF WOUND EDGE. NON-PITTING EDEMA APPEARS AS SKIN THAT IS SHINY AND TAUT. IDENTIFY PITTING EDEMA BY FIRMLY PRESSING A FINGER DOWN INTO THE TISSUES AND WAITING FOR 5 SECONDS, ON RELEASE OF PRESSURE, TISSUES FAIL TO RESUME PREVIOUS POSITION AND AN INDENTATION APPEARS.

originalText: PERIPHERAL TISSUE INDURATION
text: Is peripheral tissue induration present surrounding the wound?

responses.text: Induration > 4 cm in any area around wound

codingInstructions: INDURATION RESULTS IN AN INABILITY TO PINCH THE TISSUES.

originalText: DOES PATIENT HAVE PAIN ASSOCIATED WITH THIS WOUND?
text: Does patient have pain associated with this wound?
codingInstructions: 0 = "no pain" and 10 = "worst possible pain"

originalText: WOUND PAIN LEVEL, WHERE 0 = "NO PAIN" AND 10 = "WORST POSSIBLE PAIN"
text: Indicate wound pain level.

originalText: PAIN FREQUENCY
text: Indicate wound pain frequency.

responses.text: Patient has no pain / Pain does not interfere with activity

codingInstructions: Frequency of pain associated with the wound.

originalText: PAIN QUALITY
text: Indicate wound pain quality.
codingInstructions: Quality of pain associated with wound.

originalText: OTHER COMMENTS REGARDING PAIN QUALITY
text: Indicate other comments regarding wound pain quality.

originalText: PAIN INTERVENTIONS
text: Indicate wound pain interventions currently used by the patient.
codingInstructions: Select any interventions for pain associated with this wound.

originalText: OTHER COMMENTS REGARDING PAIN INTERVENTIONS
text: Indicate other comments regarding wound pain interventions currently used by the patient.

originalText: RESPONSE TO PAIN INTERVENTIONS
text: Indicate the patient's response to interventions currently used for wound pain.
codingInstructions: Indicate patient's response to pain interventions related to the wound.

originalText: STATE
text: Indicate whether the patient's wound is acute or chronic.
codingInstructions:
ACUTE = AN ACUTE WOUND PROCEEDS THROUGH AN ORDERLY AND TIMELY PROCESS TO PRODUCE ANATOMIC AND FUNCTIONAL INTEGRITY AND PROCEEDS THROUGH THE REPAIR PROCESS, ESTABLISHING A SUSTAINED ANATOMIC AND FUNCTIONAL RESULT.

CHRONIC = A CHRONIC WOUND HAS FAILED TO PROCEED THROUGH AN ORDERLY AND TIMELY PROCESS TO PRODUCE ANATOMIC AND FUNCTIONAL INTEGRITY OR PROCEEDED THROUGH THE REPAIR PROCESS WITHOUT ESTABLISHING A SUSTAINED ANATOMIC AND FUNCTIONAL RESULT.

originalText: SIGNS AND SYMPTOMS OF INFECTION
text: Are signs and/or symptoms of wound infection present?
codingInstructions: WOUND INFECTION MAY BE CHARACTERIZED BY ERYTHEMA, SKIN DISCOLORATION, EDEMA, WARMTH, INDURATION, INCREASED PAIN, PURULENT WOUND EXUDATE, ELEVATED TEMPERATURE, ELEVATED WBC COUNT, CONFUSION OR AGITATION IN OLDER ADULTS AND/OR RED STREAKS FROM WOUND.

originalText: DEBRIDEMENT THIS VISIT
text: Was wound debridement provided this visit?
codingInstructions: DEBRIDEMENT IS THE REMOVAL OF NECROTIC TISSUE, EXUDATE, BACTERIA, AND METABOLIC WASTE IN ORDER TO IMPROVE OR FACILITATE THE HEALING PROCESS

originalText: DEBRIDEMENT DATE
text: Indicate date of wound debridement.
codingInstructions: Indicate the date on which the wound was debrided. Unless otherwise indicated in the documents, this will be the date of the Start of Care visit.

originalText: DEBRIDEMENT TYPE
text: Indicate type of wound debridement.
codingInstructions: CHEMICAL OR ENZYMATIC DEBRIDEMENT INVOLVES APPLYING A CONCENTRATED, COMMERCIALLY PREPARED ENZYME TO THE SURFACE OF THE NECROTIC TISUE; SHARP OR SURGICAL DEBRIDEMENT INVOLVES USING A SHARP INSTRUMENT TO REMOVE NONVIABLE TISSUE; MECHANICAL DEBRIDEMENT INVOLVES THE USE OF SOME OUTSIDE FORCE TO REMOVE THE DEAD TISSUE SUCH AS WET-TO-DRY GAUZE DRESSING; AUTOLYTIC DEBRIDEMENT IS THE PROCES OF USING THE BODY'S OWN MECHANISMS TO REMOVE NONVIABLE TISSUE SUCH AS THE USE OF A MOISTURE-RETENTIVE DRESSING

originalText: OTHER COMMENTS REGARDING DEBRIDEMENT TYPE
text: Indicate other comments regarding wound debridement type.

originalText: DRAIN PRESENT
text: Is a wound drain present?
codingInstructions: Indicate whether there is a drain associated with the wound.

originalText: DRAIN TYPE
text: Indicate wound drain type.
codingInstructions: Indicate the type of drain associated with the wound.

originalText: OTHER COMMENTS REGARDING DRAIN TYPE
text: Indicate other comments regarding wound drain type.

originalText: Wound Care Orders
text: Indicate the physician's orders regarding this wound.
codingInstructions: Indicate the physician's orders regarding this wound. The response should resemble the template, including only the sentences that apply to this patient and replacing asterisks with details relevant to this patient.
template: Skilled nurse to perform/teach wound care to * site located *. Skilled nurse to cleanse with *, apply *, and cover with *, using clean/aseptic technique. Skilled nurse to cleanse wound to * with *. Prepare peri-wound area with *. Fill entire cavity with * foam. Apply tubing and cover with transparent drape. Apply negative pressure device at * mmHg for * hours. Change dressing every * and PRN. May use the following protocol as an alternative dressing as needed *.

originalText: Edit Wound Care Provided Template
text: Describe wound care provided this visit.
codingInstructions: Write a detailed clinical note on wound care provided. The response should closely resemble the template, including only the sentences that apply to this patient and replacing asterisks with details relevant to this patient.
template: Wound measurements recorded and wound pictures taken with patient's consent. Cleansed wound with *, applied *, and covered with *, using clean/aseptic technique. New drainage collector connected and old drainage container disposed of per hazardous waste protocol. Negative pressure device activated and seal achieved. Device set at * mmHg. Instructed on care of dressing/area. Instructed on signs/symptoms of infection to wound (redness, drainage, odor). Instructed on care of negative pressure machine (settings, alarms, etc.).
itemNotes: Clinical note on wound care provided & patient response.

originalText: Indicate Additional Wound Details Including Patient Response:
text: Describe patient response to wound care provided this visit.
codingInstructions: Write a detailed clinical note on patient response to wound care provided. The response should closely resemble the template, including only the sentences that apply to this patient
template: Patient vocalized tolerance to treatment provided. Patient/caregiver vocalized/demonstrated ability to perform wound care.
itemNotes: Clinical note on wound care provided.

originalText: How many skilled nursing visits should be scheduled each week for this patient?
text: How many skilled nursing visits should be scheduled each week for this patient?

originalText: Verbal Orders
text: Was a verbal order received from the patient's physician?

originalText: Verbal Order Date
text: On what date was the verbal order received?

originalText: Verbal Order Time
text: At what time was the verbal order received?

originalText: Medication interaction: comments
text: Indicate comments on medication interactions.
codingInstructions: Unless otherwise indicated in the notes, select "PCP to be notified" as the answer to this question.

originalText: Medication interaction: Other comments not in list
text: Indicate other comment on medication interactions.
codingInstructions: Provide a brief comment that can be used to address all medication interactions for the patient.

originalText: Coordination Note - Clinical Exception
text: Briefly describe the medication issue and follow up. Was medication follow-up completed by midnight the next calendar day?
alternateQuestionText: Briefly describe the medication issue found during the Start of Care medication review. Also, describe any follow up actions taken, including communication with the patient's physician. Indicate whether the physician was contacted by midnight the next calendar day following the start of care visit.
template:
Briefly describe the medication issue and follow up: [description of medication issue and follow-up actions taken goes here]

Was medication follow-up completed by midnight the next calendar day? [indicate yes or no]

originalText: Are there Supply Requisition Comments?
text: Are there any comments on the supplies to be ordered for this patient or on the supply requisition process?
codingInstructions: Unless otherwise indicated in the notes, select "No" as the answer to this question.

originalText: Supply Requisition Comments
text: Indicate comments on supplies to be ordered for this patient or on the supply requisition process.
codingInstructions: Provide any details directly related to the ordering or delivery of home health supplies for this patient.

originalText: Entitlement Verification
text: Should an Entitlement Verification be completed for this patient in Apricot?
codingInstructions: Unless otherwise indicated in the notes, select "No" as the answer to this question.

originalText: HAS THE PATIENT RECEIVED A KIDNEY TRANSPLANT? - TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N (114337)
text: Has the patient received a kidney transplant?

text: Date of transplant:
alternateQuestionText: Indicate date of patient's kidney transplant

originalText: HAS THE PATIENT RECEIVED MAINTENANCE DIALYSIS TREATMENT? - TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N (114339)
text: Has the patient received maintenance dialysis treatment?

originalText: DATE DIALYSIS BEGAN: - TYPE: DATE - MULTISELECT: N (114340)
text: Date dialysis began:
alternateQuestionText: Indicate date that patient's maintenance dialysis treatment began.

originalText: HAS THE PATIENT PARTICIPATED IN A SELF DIALYSIS TRAINING PROGRAM? - TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N (114341)
text: Has the patient participated in a self-dialysis training program?

originalText: DATE SELF DIALYSIS TRAINING PROGRAM STARTED: - TYPE: DATE - MULTISELECT: N (114342)
text: Date self-dialysis training program started:
alternateQuestionText: Indicate date that patient's self-dialysis training program started.

originalText: IS THE PATIENT WITHIN THE 30 MONTH COORDINATION PERIOD? (NO = MEDICARE IS PRIMARY) - TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N (114343)
text: Is the patient within the 30 month coordination period?
alternateQuestionText: Please determine if the patient is currently within the 30-month coordination period for End-Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) Medicare coverage. Consider the patient's ESRD diagnosis date, dialysis start date, and current insurance coverage (such as employer-sponsored, retiree, or COBRA) to make this determination.

originalText: IS THE PATIENT ENTITLED TO MEDICARE ON THE BASIS OF EITHER ESRD AND AGE OR ESRD AND DISABILITY? - TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N (114344)
text: Is the patient entitled to Medicare on the basis of either ESRD and age or ESRD and disability?
alternateQuestionText: Is the patient entitled to Medicare coverage due to End-Stage Renal Disease (ESRD) combined with either their age or disability status?

originalText: WAS THE INITIAL ENTITLEMENT TO MEDICARE (INCLUDING SIMULTANEOUS ENTITLEMENT) BASED ON ESRD? - TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N (114345)
text: Was the initial entitlement to Medicare (including simultaneous entitlement) based on ESRD?
alternateQuestionText: Was the patient's initial entitlement to Medicare (including simultaneous entitlement) based on ESRD?

originalText: DOES THE WORKING AGED OR DISABILITY MSP PROVISION APPLY ( I.E., IS THE GHP PRIMARY BASED ON AGE OR DISABILITY ENTITLEMENT)? - TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N (114346)
text: Does the Working Aged or Disability MSP Provision apply (i.e. is the GHP primary based on age or disability entitlement)?
alternateQuestionText: Does the Working Aged or Disability Medicare Secondary Payer (MSP) provision apply for this patient? In other words, is the patient's Group Health Plan (GHP) considered the primary payer based on the patient's age or disability entitlement?

originalText: ARE THE SERVICES TO BE PAID BY A GOVERNMENT PROGRAM SUCH AS A RESEARCH GRANT? - TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N (114298)
text: Are the services to be paid by a government program such as a research grant?
alternateQuestionText: Are home health services for this patient to be paid by a government program such as a research grant?

originalText: GOVERNMENT PROGRAM: - TYPE: TEXT - MULTISELECT: N (114307)
text: Details of government program funding:
alternateQuestionText: Provide details about government program funding for the patient's home health services.

originalText: HAS THE DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS (DVA) AUTHORIZED AND AGREED TO PAY FOR CARE? - TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N (114300)
text: Has the Department of Veterans Affairs (DVA) authorized and agreed to pay for care?
alternateQuestionText: Has the Department of Veterans Affairs (DVA) authorized and agreed to pay for home health care for this patient?

originalText: DETAILS OF DVA AUTHORIZATION: - TYPE: TEXT - MULTISELECT. N (114308)
text: Details of DVA authorization:
alternateQuestionText: Provide details about the Department of Veterans Affairs (DVA) authorization to pay for home health care for this patient.

originalText: WAS THE ILLNESS/INJURY DUE TO A WORK RELATED ACCIDENT/CONDITION? - TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N (114301)
text: Was the illness/injury due to a work-related accident/condition?
alternateQuestionText: Was the patient's current illness/injury due to a work-related accident/condition?

originalText: DATE OF INJURY/ILLNESS: - TYPE: DATE - MULTISELECT: N (114309)
text: Date of injury/illness:
alternateQuestionText: Indicate the date of the patient's current illness/injury that is due to a work-related accident/condition.

originalText: NAME AND ADDRESS OF INSURANCE CARRIER: - TYPE: TEXT - MULTISELECT: N (114310)
text: Name and address of insurance carrier:
alternateQuestionText: What is the name and address of the insurance carrier associated with the patient's work-related accident/condition?

originalText: POLICY OR IDENTIFICATION NUMBER: - TYPE: TEXT - MULTISELECT: N (114311)
text: Policy or identification number:
alternateQuestionText: What is the insurance policy or identification number associated with the patient's work-related accident/condition?

originalText: NAME AND ADDRESS OF EMPLOYER: - TYPE: TEXT - MULTISELECT: N (114312)
text: Name and address of employer:
alternateQuestionText: What is the name and address of the employer associated with the patient's work-related accident/condition?

originalText: IS THE PATIENT RECEIVING TREATMENT FOR AN INJURY, OR ILLNESS, WHICH ANOTHER PARTY MAY BE LIABLE? - TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N (114302)
text: Is the patient receiving treatment for an injury or illness for which another party may be liable?

originalText: DATE OF WORKPLACE ILLNESS OR THE INJURY: - TYPE: DATE - MULTISELECT: N (114313)
text: Date of workplace injury or illness:
alternateQuestionText: Indicate the date of the patient's workplace illness or injury.

originalText: WHAT TYPE OF ACCIDENT CAUSED THE ILLNESS/INJURY? - TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N (114314)
text: What type of accident caused the illness/injury?
alternateQuestionText: What type of accident caused the patient's workplace illness/injury?

originalText: NAME AND ADDRESS OF INSURANCE CARRIER: - TYPE: TEXT - MULTISELECT: N (114315)
text: Name and address of insurance carrier:
alternateQuestionText: What is the name and address of the insurance carrier associated with the patient's workplace illness/injury?

originalText: INSURANCE CLAIM NUMBER: - TYPE: TEXT - MULTISELECT: N (114316)
text: Insurance claim number:
alternateQuestionText: What is the insurance claim number associated with the patient's workplace illness/injury?

originalText: WAS ANOTHER PARTY RESPONSIBLE FOR THIS ACCIDENT? - TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N (114317)
text: Was another party responsible for this accident?
alternateQuestionText: Was another party responsible for the patient's workplace accident?

originalText: NAME AND ADDRESS OF INSURANCE CARRIER: - TYPE: TEXT - MULTISELECT: N (114318)
text: Name and address of insurance carrier:
alternateQuestionText: What is the name and address of the insurance carrier associated with the other party responsible for the patient's workplace illness/injury?

originalText: INSURANCE CLAIM NUMBER: - TYPE: TEXT - MULTISELECT: N (114316)
text: Insurance claim number:
alternateQuestionText: What is the insurance claim number associated with the other party responsible for the patient's workplace illness/injury?

originalText: ARE THERE COMMENTS REGARDING THE ENTITLEMENT ASSESSMENT? - TYPE: LIST - MULTISELECT: N (117281)
text: Are there comments regarding the entitlement assessment?
alternateQuestionText: Are there comments regarding the patient's Medicare entitlement assessment?

originalText: COMMENTS: - TYPE: TEXT - MULTISELECT: N (114348)
text: Comments:
alternateQuestionText: Indicate comments regarding the patient's Medicare entitlement assessment.
